tweet.bodyText: Things no-one else is crazy enough to be doing right now: final prep for a trip to answer one of the great unanswered questions: just how far can you travel by bus from London in 24hrs? I *think* I know on paper, but in practice…? Follow along from 3am as I slowly go mad. #bus24 https://t.co/Ga8hzYwgP6
@politic_animal @NickWhithorn Like. Priestley's "English Journey", but with buses.
@politic_animal This was absolutely wonderful. Thank you!
@politic_animal Oh and thank you for introducing me to Milka Tender Cows.
@politic_animal Well, you seem to have passed through most of the places I have lived!
@politic_animal Twice as far as York
@politic_animal What a great idea! I have enjoyed following your progress. Thanks for an entertaining day.
@politic_animal @owain_dafydd think you’ll like this thread.
@beardybob82 @politic_animal I’m so incredibly vested in this.
@politic_animal Paging @JonnElledge in case you've not seen this...
@politic_animal @Hashtagwhybird I've been enjoying this thread all day. I hope you have too. Seems like something you would enjoy!
Today's Dead Good Thing: @politic_animal is trying to get as far from London as they can by bus in 24 hours. Follow #bus24. They're in Manchester at the moment. https://t.co/RlVNTZDgxN
@politic_animal Ah, so this is why @WildShrews is getting take away...
@politic_animal This would have been so much more fun for you if you had got Cliff Richard and the Shadows involved 👍
@politic_animal How much planning did this journey take? How many routes were discounted? The planning that has gone in to this is incredible
@fens_commuter Quite a bit - lots of very similar length routes, so a lot of work at the margins. Filled up a few journeys to and from work!
@politic_animal @fens_commuter Nice work, surprised you didn't do the Derby, Sheffield, Wakefield, Leeds York, Durham route though. Did they times just not align?

@Dan__Russell__ @fens_commuter No. Getting north of York is really tricky, especially towards the evening when I would have got there. Scarborough is probably as far as you can get up the eastern side (but it is possible I am wrong!).
@politic_animal @fens_commuter Thanks, once again a magnificent achievement https://t.co/JxL5WEB9mg
@politic_animal Your spreadsheets must be a thing of beauty! Thank you. Enjoy the rest of the day and fingers crossed you don’t fall asleep and miss your stop
@politic_animal I've missed you. I left Twitter for my Mayoral year and just catching up with lovely people like yourself.
@ValStev24404147 Hope the mayoralty went well!
@politic_animal All in lockdown. Only chaired zoom meetings. So an unusual year.

@politic_animal Good luck!

Feel like a right anorak following this, but here we are.
@politic_animal @molybdomantic I once tried planning Lands End to John O'Groats by local bus - I didn't get very far!
@politic_animal You could buy a red rover ticket which gave you 24 hours unlimited travel.  This was in the 1960s.  I did it with my sister .
@politic_animal @EdwardAdoo I think you will enjoy this thread! 🚍👍🏻
@SaraTofusal @politic_animal Wow I’m up for the challenge. 24 hours on bus. Let’s go 🙌🏿🙌🏿
@EdwardAdoo @politic_animal He went through the 3 Counties so you could invite him onto your show!
@politic_animal Loving this thread!
@politic_animal I have bet a pint on you finishing closer to Newcastle than Carlisle... In other news I hear there are big traffic jams in Cumbria, might want to avoid that area.
@apmcdonnell I think you might lose your pint.
@politic_animal 😞 still thank you for the excellent entertainment!

@politic_animal I can tell you that you could travel from Portsmouth to North London by local buses alone, in 1964. Can't remember how long it took. Interesting ride though. That was the good old days when single decker buses were sneered at and comfortable seats for the weak willed.
@politic_animal This is glorious! But how are you getting home?
@LittleLorrie1 By train!
@politic_animal Ahhh, good plan. I was fretting about you being stranded near Carlisle.
@politic_animal Have you seen this @garius
@politic_animal @bustimes_org @BenLuck1989
@politic_animal Are the fares all similarly priced in Grimsby/Cleethorpes its £1.70 regardless of where you go lol

@politic_animal I remember a late decision to do rag week ‘hitch as far as you can in a day’ one weekend. We made it from London to, I think, the Bobby McGregor swimming pool in Glasgow. Decided too late to get sponsored.
@politic_animal @DJKSaunders this thread looks like one for you to give a go
@politic_animal I don't know why this is so fascinating but it absolutely is. Great work
@politic_animal Great stuff very interesting how’s it going love to read more
@politic_animal Oh this is great. Hope you at least make Newcastle but is Scotland a possibility?
@duncanbudd Scotland isn’t possible, alas.
@politic_animal Quick question - are you making notes of the cost of each bus ticket? Would be really interesting especially cost per mile of them.
@TwinsNthings I’m keeping them all, so I will tot it up at the end.

@politic_animal @TwinsNthings 15-ish years ago, I visited my now wife near Tynemouth from just outside Woking. Was walking to Woking station & it started raining as a bus passed so I took it. About £3.50 for a 5 minute trip. Other end was a bus from Newcastle. Similar price did the full 10 miles. Both Arriva.
@politic_animal @TwinsNthings Of course you are! And I'm loving your "rules" for the journey. You've really thought about this, haven't you?
@politic_animal are you going to be going through Nottingham or Sheffield? I have some friends who would love to wave you on your way
@katie_broke Afraid neither are on my route, but thanks!
@politic_animal alas! we shall wave from further away through Twitter instead then!
@politic_animal also would love to provide snack - marathon water station style
@politic_animal Where can I get a knitted tortoise??
@maryorelse My wife made 3 of them on endless train journeys to and from Scarborough.
@politic_animal @Jamesashe95 is this you
@politic_animal Oh, local / regional bus. I guess my continental linguistic bias confounds bus and coach.
@AlgosJoni Yes, exactly. Could get well into Scotland if I included express coaches!
@politic_animal Or Barcelona!
@politic_animal I still have hopes that you reach Scotland before midnight, but might include some walks I guess
@AlgosJoni Afraid not - buses are too sparse in the far north to get that far.
@politic_animal Interesting, sounds like route choice is tough. Holyhead, Penzance?
@AlgosJoni Could nearly manage Holyhead, which would have beaten where I am going by a few miles, but can’t quite get timings to work.
@politic_animal Did you also map out toilet stops, or did you take other measures?
@politic_animal Can you calculate how much this would cost without free travel?
@helloianc I don’t have free travel - that’s just my guideline for what services are permissible. Not totted it up in full yet, but likely to be around £40.
@politic_animal What is a 'tender cow' and where can I buy a pack?
@JRBrown888 @politic_animal Iceland sell them round my way.
@JRBrown888 A sort of chocolate chip madeleine. Any shop selling obscure imported foodstuffs!
@politic_animal @JRBrown888 Do they sell Swiss crisps too? https://t.co/TXDw3HPdDK
@politic_animal @JRBrown888 Why have I never thought to put chocolate chips in madeleines!? Loving the stops at High Wycombe, Northampton and Harborough, ticking my personal connection boxes there.

@politic_animal Which seat have you been aiming for on each bus?

Presumably upstairs front-right (above the driver) on a double decker, and front row of the 'mezzanine floor' (above the rear wheels) on a single decker?
@WillPitman @politic_animal Best thing about taking the upstairs front right seat is you can pretend you're the driver!! And get the best views.

@politic_animal This is brilliant - how's it all going? 
Enjoy yourself as much as I am following you.
@politic_animal Loving your work
@politic_animal There's a cup of tea waiting for you if you can get here.. https://t.co/Z78dZWwpDJ
@NatalieBayfield That might be a stretch!
@politic_animal Loving this exercise. Looking forward to finding out where you end up 😀

@politic_animal This could be your next step!

https://t.co/bkdu4adhbz

@politic_animal Very much enjoying watching your progress. I once travelled around the coast of mainland Britain only using local buses and your videos of bus stations are bringing it all back. Best thing I learnt was that the seat by the emergency exit has the most leg room. Bon voyage!
@politic_animal I am distressed that #bus24 doesn't seem to involve going on a No.24 bus.
@HelenEva8 Just checked my schedule - sorry, no 24s.
@politic_animal Brilliant! Enjoy your 24hrs.
@politic_animal Is their a specific measure? And is it miles travelled or is it straight line distance at end point?
@a6ruled_WFH Straight line distance from Charing Cross. Otherwise you could rack up mileage by shuttling up and down Whitehall all day!
@politic_animal Of course… I had some thoughts about “knowing from the shape if it’s real journey” and now I wonder how quickly one could circumnavigate London always staying outside the M25.
@a6ruled_WFH @politic_animal Won't that require a ferry?
@aww_maan @politic_animal Also think the Tilbury Ferry would be in the spirit of the thing.
@aww_maan @politic_animal Good point. Although having done a little online research I think there’s a strong argument for allowing the QE2 bridge southbound.

So, it’s just gone 3am, and the odyssey begins. I’m at Charing Cross, the point from which all distances from London are measured, and the aim is to get as far a possible from here in 24 hours. And here’s my first bus, London’s fourth longest route. Start the clock! #bus24 https://t.co/xH9vnNJtcj
@politic_animal @travellingcoral I wasn’t expecting you to come via my town, Loughborough, in your trek across the land!
@politic_animal This is wonderful. Pinging @DrDreHistorian, whom I feel would enjoy this particular journey, even though it is buses and not trains.
@catescates @politic_animal This is thoroughly entertaining!
@DrDreHistorian @politic_animal I find it inspiring! Awesome project.
@politic_animal I can't find any mention in the timetable of the N9 going to Camden Town?
@akersley It doesn’t - the driver was scrolling the destination blind to get round to Heathrow.
@politic_animal Loving this. Will follow thoughout the day :)

@politic_animal Fantastic. We once circumnavigated Gran Canaria by bus to see if it could be done - it took about 8 hours.

Love a crazy bus adventure - have a great day!

One of the joys of Nightbus travel is the gentle rhythm of stops being announced as the bus swings non-stop past them. This bus is struggling though, announcing random stops wherever it likes, like ‘QPR Stadium’ while in Kensington or ‘Surbiton station’ in Hammersmith. #bus24
No sign of any goats. We nearly ran over a fox carrying some chicken drumsticks though. https://t.co/kpvpG0i4eE
@politic_animal 😅😅😅
@politic_animal Stocking up at Nandos?

@politic_animal So that's why Nando's have run out.

I can see the headlines now   ...

The excitement of taking the N9 all the way to Terminal 5 is that you get to go through the Heathrow Tunnel on a double decker twice. The other excitement is that my first connection is already looking quite tight… https://t.co/2GfOMcYniw

Nah, made it fine in the end. Now on a very purple number 7, all to myself. Quitting the stifling metropolitan mores of Greater London for the fresh, honest air of Slough. #bus24 https://t.co/2KsKDr6DNR
@politic_animal Slough's air is not fresh. Take that back.
@amancalledmikey Sorry to besmirch.
@politic_animal The only place I know that suffers from milk powder-related pollution. That Horlick's factory is to blame.
Absolute voyage of discovery on the number 7. #bus24 https://t.co/EcUAAvxi3h
@politic_animal I’m originally from Slough and I did not know this

The old Slough bus station - concrete monstrosity par excellence - features for a split second in the opening sequence of The Office. The new one couldn’t be much more different, resembling a sort of shiny metallic worm. #bus24 https://t.co/X277i3IjZc
@politic_animal The old Slough bus station had The Worst Toilet in England. It was like the scene from Trainspotting, complete with junkie.
@politic_animal PS Sir, I salute your indefatigability. I have wondered myself about the question you seek to answer.
@lewis_baston @politic_animal I’m impressed that you braved the bus station toilet.
@dzyrl @politic_animal I didn’t persevere. I think I managed to hold on until Windsor.

If anyone thought our destination lay in the west …hah, fooled you. Now swinging north into the Chiltern foothills (via Slough Trading Estate, allegedly Europe’s largest) on the first X74 of the day to High Wycombe. #bus24 https://t.co/PKPu2SMTfN
@politic_animal Apparently this bus is an express because it goes for 1 junction along the M40.
@ccityplanner12 Indeed. Very exciting it is too!
@politic_animal At least we now know your phone isn't broken!
@politic_animal No allegedly about it. I used to work on it for several years.
Time for the first Tender Cow of the day. #bus24 https://t.co/CKXniIJnLG
@politic_animal I love these!
@politic_animal Oooh. 24 hours of logistics.  I hope you fasted before starting.  24 hours with few facilities....
@StratfordLeeEsq I have been prudent!
@politic_animal Is that the kendal mint cake of the bus route explorers world?
High Wycombe bus station. At left, what is claimed to be ‘The UK’s first fashionable face mask vending machine’. A low bar to clear, I feel. #bus24 https://t.co/ZO6OkjnjiP
@politic_animal Oh, the glamour!
The buses are getting smaller. #bus24 https://t.co/xxy3r8PXzc
Starting to look a touch autumnal in the misty Chilterns, as the 300 rattles it’s way toward Aylesbury. #bus24 https://t.co/o4cPorhPH3
@politic_animal Heading out via princes risborough
Paralympic swooshes on the roundabout at Stoke Mandeville Hospital, birthplace of the Paralympics. #bus24 https://t.co/lkLOWxeahp

Aylesbury bus station. The sort of place that really makes you feel like A Valued Public Transport User. Somewhere is going to have to try hard to beat this for accolade of worst bus station of the journey. #bus24 https://t.co/MLnqibK1Um
@politic_animal Ah yes, in the bowels of the also grim shopping centre.

@politic_animal If your northerly route takes you via Grantham ours easily has that beat. It's just, like, four bus stops welded together in a broken-up potholed car park out the back of the shopping centre by the bins.
@politic_animal Victoria coach station arrivals is pretty dismal... Hardly a warm welcome to one of the greatest cities in the world.
@politic_animal Preston Bus station. I hope you get that far to experience the joys of brutalist concrete architecture in northern England!
@politic_animal Lincoln's station used to look like this, got completely rebuilt a few years ago, expensive to do
@politic_animal Northampton's is pretty grim.  Or was.  Might have been rebuilt.
@suzyg001 Will be there later - it has been rebuilt apparently!
@politic_animal 🙌🙌🙌

First independent operator of the day, Red Rose, who despite sounding like they should be based in Accrington, not Aylesbury, have cornered the lucrative rail-less (for now) Aylesbury-Milton Keynes express corridor. Slightly odd buses, with a single table in them. #bus24 https://t.co/yJ1tZybNVC
@politic_animal Last time I took a red rose was one of the most uncomfortable journeys of my life, utterly lacking suspension. Godspeed
@benerationx The suspension was ok, which is just as well as the driver did like to bounce off every available kerb.

Through the village of Wing, which in the early 1970s nearly fell terribly foul of nominative determinism by being proposed for demolition in order to build a four-runway third airport for London. #bus24 https://t.co/TJYmsBi5vB
@politic_animal As you were travelling through Wing I was there too. At the GPs, having blood tests. I could have waved at you, had I been aware of this brilliant thread yesterday. Well done 👏 xx

@politic_animal There is also a Wing in Rutland. It has a rather fine turf maze.
https://t.co/cdCCPs0eBy
@politic_animal Oh the bus didn’t go into Leighton Buzzard? I was just getting excited at Wing 😉
@LBACSimon The 100 goes round the by-pass.
@politic_animal Ah. Left at the Wing roundabout. Bloody hard to get across that on one of my running routes!
@politic_animal Another London airport not in London ☺️

They’re not wrong when they say Milton Keynes is full of roundabouts, are they? Might have to do a Best Of compilation. Also, a bit confused to be greeted by this, which appears to be straight out of Tirana, when I got off the bus. #bus24 https://t.co/Xg4P1knJgt
@politic_animal It does look like that Tirana pyramid! Great view from the top as I remember. Milton Keynes probably less developed than Albania…
@politic_animal The point! Used to go to the cinema there as a teen!
@LouiseBrogan3 I have been appropriately educated by a host of Keynesers (?)/Miltonians (?).
@politic_animal 😂😂 the only reason we used to go there. Teen day out - train ride, film and a MaccyD’s. Miltkeynians? Lol
@politic_animal We’re following your journey (along with several other members of @transportsparks )   while sat at The Point on a 1!
@politic_animal The first multi-screen cinema in the UK! Who says MK has no history.
@politic_animal That’s the Point. Fist multiplex cinema in the UK. Been neglected for many years and hearing it is to be demolished.
@politic_animal I once had a calendar of the roundabouts of Milton Keynes. Dead serious.

First double decker since leaving London. And it appears to be entirely for me. The X6 arrives at the rather nice substitute for a bus station in Milton Keynes (a tree-lined boulevard) to take me to Northampton. #bus24 https://t.co/MiPHryBDGT
@politic_animal why do you snub Bedford, what about my home town do you hate so much ? ;)
@liversedge Spent much of the first part of the week in Bedford finding a house for a relative, so it has had its share of me!
@politic_animal I left 30 years ago and every time I go back see it with older eyes. At once 70s and 80s blandness yet a proud civic history seeps through everything.
@politic_animal Just to say that I'm enjoying this thread. What's the ticketing situation been like?
@ae_baldwin Having to piece together bits of rovers and the odd individual ticket. Not particularly cheap, but at least everyone takes contactless these days.

A little secret to making good progress is finding a chain of towns/cities all about an hour apart - there will generally be a fastish bus between each of them. The E Midlands provide precisely that. Now on a stretch of the X6 route that has no scheduled stop for 16mins. #bus24 https://t.co/pjNjoacKUK
@politic_animal Loving your journey! Have you preplanned using #Rome2Rio, or are you doing this all on the hoof? 💚
@politic_animal A5!

Just realised that by nine am, I’ve ticked off all three of the ‘big’ bus operators - First, Stagecoach and Arriva. First and Arriva are winning so far, because their buses have given me tasty, tasty electricity. #bus24 https://t.co/OXi9Yn6wGy
@politic_animal A508! Where the road goes through Roade.
@politic_animal No great surprise Stagecoach finish last on this list. The south east hasn't seen a bus on time since the early 90s.
@politic_animal what no Go-Ahead?

Northampton’s All Saints’ Church is rather impressive. The X6 terminates right outside it, as the new bus station is too small and the entire town centre is a bus interchange. But the old bus station was called ‘a portal to hell’ by the local press, so prob for the best. #bus24 https://t.co/GKW1NZiw3t
@politic_animal Fame at last, @purgstallheath.
@chinmj @politic_animal I was wondering when it would come.

@politic_animal Greyfriars was functional but grim. And, perhaps most importantly to its demolition, unmaintained to the point where it became uneconomic to keep.

And the feeling I got with the whole dealing with L&G was that someone somewhere dropped a contractual clanger.

@politic_animal Although an eye-sore, the bus station did at least have buses - a vital ingredient if you're trying to catch one, but a necessity overlooked by the administration of the time. The @ChronandEcho is not a reliable indicator of local opinion.
@politic_animal I wasn't a Northampton resident in the Greyfriars days, but - inevitably - everyone now is fuming in the Chronicle that the old bus station was closed down.
@politic_animal What a fab idea for a trip.  Many years ago our office tried furthest from Solihull on a single bus, and had a nice curry in Sutton Coldfield.  But you beat that for ambition!

Features of the rather nice if diminutive Northampton bus station include a plaque to commemorate the former Jewish quarter once on the site, and the rather chipper lions of the town coat of arms. Oh, and some buses. https://t.co/ZOY9YQpA4v
@politic_animal You didn’t mention the defibrillator

@politic_animal no way near as interesting as what you are doing but you could have got your answer here.  would be interesting to test the results though.
https://t.co/4sUR5gbWYr

That excellent moment, with 20 minutes between buses, when you find that your endlessly patient wife packed you lychees. To go with the slow travel mascot crocheted Turtle. #bus24 https://t.co/FRg7DWSfOn
@politic_animal Lychees *for* the turtle I think you'll find.
@politic_animal I'm glad the turtle went too :)
@politic_animal You mean you didn't invite the wife along on this epic adventure?!
@PaulieTandoori For some reason, incomprehensibly, she preferred to work today.
@politic_animal At least she, and we, have the joys of your travelogue to follow I suppose.

Nice consecutive switch from the X6 to the X7 in Northampton to continue north. Very swish bus, with padded leather seats, USB chargers and the rest, just slightly let down by the fact it is fully branded for a route in Coventry. #bus24 https://t.co/EAGpMVjnwx
@politic_animal If a bus is fully branded for a route in Coventry, does that mean you have to ride it naked through the town?
@politic_animal 👋🏻 I’ll be waving when you pass my house! Let me guess, X1 to Brum next?
@SarahMatthew1 @politic_animal If you do get the actual X1 then I’ll make a point of going and waving too. Literally passes the bottom of my road.
Northampton goes on for a *very* long way, doesn’t it? #bus24
@politic_animal Most land locked place in Britain I believe  - I used to live there. Always took a long time to leave ...
It does end eventually. #bus24 https://t.co/pgJqSu9F5D
@politic_animal This thread is wonderful but, having given birth to twins last week, extremely triggering for my backache.
@remainwithkate *Some* of the seats are quite comfortable (the current ones in particular). Others less so. Wouldn’t recommend as a pastime in your case.

@politic_animal That's a shame for our two-year-old. Add in a tram and it would be his idea of heaven.

I'd love to know how you planned it. And looking forward to seeing where you end up!
@politic_animal Brilliant - when does it end? Are you going to midnight?
@RogerB_worth I have 24hrs and started at 3:05am!

@politic_animal Going for the border?

Good luck!

@politic_animal I tried a similar venture as a youth - there was a thing called a Wayfarer pass that got one a long way. I got from Southampton as far as Leicester but couldn’t get back - ended up staying with my uncle and aunt in Solihull.
Now held up in a small Northamptonshire village by a couple of young people attempting to pay too little. Tut. Would never happen in south east London… #bus24
@politic_animal Really enjoying this!
@politic_animal I dread to think how much you've shelled out for this 😄

Super views over the north Northamptonshire hills, looking across to Naesby, where 1,400 people died in perhaps England’s most consequential battle since Hastings. (And which led to the original Charing Cross, my starting point, being pulled down.) #bus24 https://t.co/I1eaPJpMnX

@politic_animal If you make it as far north as Penrith, you'll go past the last battlefield in England in Clifton, just south of Penrith on the A6
Not sure there's a bus service though 👀

Market Harborough, where we were supposed to maintain a polite fiction of stopping for a bit and pretending to become a different bus in order to game the drivers’ hours regulations. But we are 10 mins late, so we didn’t. Feels like a town that could do with less traffic… #bus24 https://t.co/OWLjWk0AQG

@politic_animal It also feels like a town that could do without a very loud church that keeps ringing all through the night directly across the street from the nost central hotel. Not that I'm bitter.

The X7 has been delayed a bit more for the slightly surprising reason that the driver revealed he could indeed parla italiano to the couple who got on on the edge of Market Harborough and wanted due biglietti, solo andata, per Leicester. #bus24 https://t.co/F6Va2SRv9N
@politic_animal So enjoying this thread. Safe travels! 🚍👍🏻
@politic_animal This is absolutely MAGNIFICENT
@politic_animal Benissimo!

Kibworth Beauchamp is the sort of village name we make up to amuse visiting tourists. And they would be further amused if they knew the village is mainly owned by Merton College Oxford, because its founder bought it off a failed baron in the 12th century. #bus24 https://t.co/gqKszwHcWW
@politic_animal Presumably, it cost him precisely one kib.
@politic_animal Fully half of rural Leicestershire village names sound like minor Dickens characters.
@politic_animal Isn't that the place in the Michael Wood series a few years ago?
@smoulderstoat Yes!
@politic_animal I'm gripped! I reckon you'll be heading to Derby-Uttoxeter-Stoke and North West from there, or Nottingham-Chesterfield-Sheffield. But which will it be?!

@DavidAppleyard1 @politic_animal It's got to be Nottingham. Can't miss the chance of going through Gotham surely? There's a tweet in that since Gotham City (and New York) do get their names (and nicknames) from a tiny village in Nottinghamshire.
@GrumpyN1ck @DavidAppleyard1 I may disappoint you, I’m afraid!
@politic_animal @DavidAppleyard1 Shame, still enjoying the journey.

What with bilingual bus drivers, endless temp traffic lights and general snarl ups over medieval bridges, the 20 min connection between two bus stations in Leicester (why do you need two, Leicester?) is looking unlikely. Luckily, there’s a bit of slack in the schedule… #bus24
Leicester railway station is a very fine thing indeed. Be good if it was closer to the bus stations, mind. #bus24 https://t.co/PfVElrzFd8
@politic_animal Leicester Central station was closer to where the bus stations now are
@politic_animal There is a stop at the station
@politic_animal @lordbonkers I would advocate that @LeicsCountyHall build an underpass from one to t’other.

18 minutes late into Haymarket bus station in Leicester, giving me 2 minutes to make the planned connection at St Margaret’s bus station, a few blocks away. Never mind. We just need the next bus to be reasonably punctual! #bus24 https://t.co/KqQa46pbDh
Turns out they have knocked down St Margaret’s bus station, but never fear, there are some grand alternative waiting facilities provided. #bus24 https://t.co/Gy93ji5FAq
@politic_animal Haunts of my yoof. Waiting for the 118 to Swadlincote.
@politic_animal Knocking down St. Margaret’s - another Tory evil plot

The next bus is clearly very grand, too grand to have a number. It’s just called Skylink (it serves East Midlands Airport along with loads of villages between Leicester and Derby), and is run by the excellently named Kinchbus. Very nice buses they are too. #bus24 https://t.co/kloog0u2a8
@politic_animal I used to take that bus to work.   Generally a good service
Speeding along the A6 past Quorn, famed (I think) for the world’s only vegetarian fox hunt. #bus24 https://t.co/YgbrqZyzD6
@politic_animal Why would one hunt vegetarian foxes? And how does one know its vegetarian?
@politic_animal As someone who has launched some truly terrible puns into the world, can I just say how much I appreciate your work right here in this tweet?
Nice bit of mid-journey touch point cleaning from Kinchbus while we are stopped at Loughborough. #bus24 https://t.co/AipypNMytT
@politic_animal This bus got me home from many a night out in Leicester back in the day - glad you enjoyed!

@politic_animal If I wasn't so busy today I could have walked the several minutes to wave at you through the window. As it is, probably best to have avoided that kind of awkwardness isn't it really? Good luck to you in the second half
Glimpses of the Leicestershire countryside (and the A42) as we storm along country lanes towards the airport. #bus24 https://t.co/en433g3FlC
@politic_animal Are you by any chance doing the East Midlands Airport to Nottingham bus route next?
@G_IW No, staying on this bus to Derby.
